Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 00:24 - We can now confirm that all power in the Woodbridge IP13 6 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around the underground network fault to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused, and how long you may have been off for. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we estimated is now approaching.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Theo at 23:50.

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 01:03
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 01:30 and 02:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Theo at 23:18.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 23:15 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 04:30 and 05:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 20:30 - A final message from us this evening to let you know that our teams on site are progressing well with internal checks at properties, while our engineers continue their work to resolve the issue.

Our customer champions, along with food van and support vehicle will be remaining on site until 22:00, located in the car park of a block flats near to number 88, so please do visit them before this time if you need any additional support. If you cannot travel to the vehicle, then our team are also by available by phone on 08003163105, and will be throughout the night.

We will be back in touch by message tomorrow morning, but if you no longer wish to receive updates then please follow this link to unsubscribe - bit.ly/348KOZ3.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 16:13 - We can now confirm that all power in the Target Firs area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 14:56 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Sent by Lisa at 20:38 - We can now confirm that all power in the Lennard Road should be back on. The issue was due to an underground cable fault, however engineers have managed to restore power from the substation nearby and will be investigating the root cause.

If there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Sent by Lisa at 20:05 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers.

Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair.

We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change.

For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.

Sent by Stuart at 19:56 - We have been made aware that power has not been restored to the Lennard Road area. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

The estimated time frame remains between 22:00-23:00 at present, and we will continue to keep you informed of progress. If your power is back on, you will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe from receiving texts. Thank you

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 20:41 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

MainMessage: We have made a temporary repair to our network to restore supplies.  However, it will be necessary for us to undertake further works to make a permanent repair, and the details have been passed to our Maintenance department.    If you will be affected by the work, you will be given written notice in advance.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 06:37 - We can now confirm that all power in the Mead Way area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Talie, Joe, Will and Aaron are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 05:53 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 23:49 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired a fault on the underground network in the Curzon Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage and how long you were off for. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 23:26
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Theo - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 20:30 - A final message from us this evening to let you know that our teams on site are progressing well with internal checks at properties, while our engineers continue their work to resolve the issue.

Our customer champions, along with food van and support vehicle will be remaining on site until 22:00, located in the car park of a block flats near to number 88, so please do visit them before this time if you need any additional support. If you cannot travel to the vehicle, then our team are also by available by phone on 08003163105, and will be throughout the night.

We will be back in touch by message tomorrow morning, but if you no longer wish to receive updates then please follow this link to unsubscribe - bit.ly/348KOZ3.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 17:07 - Our team on site have advised that internal checks to all properties affected are progressing well, and we are looking to visit any properties that have not yet had these checks this evening. If you have any concerns our customer champions are on site to help, or you can call us on 08003163105, which is free from landlines and mobiles. 

Our customer support vehicle and food van are still located in the car park of a block flats neat to number 88, and will remain on site until 22:00 to provide support.

We will continue to send updates as and when we get them from our colleagues on site, but if you no longer wish to receive these then please follow this link to unsubscribe - bit.ly/348KOZ3.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Aaron from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 13:22 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is that initially interrupted power to 317 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 112 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 14:30-15:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
